rename.to: 0.990 reports error for function with body that is just ellipsis

body: This was an intentional change in 0.990 and the special casing for `...` bodies was mostly removed (#13729). The documentation seems to be now out of date.
Yep, I will update the docs. Now you need `--allow-empty-bodies` if you want old behavior (or disable empty-body error code in your mypy config)

Thank's for clarifying.

> Now you need --allow-empty-bodies if you want old behavior

I'm unsure if I want the old behaviorðŸ¤” Actually I was ever in doubt if the way I used such `...` stubs was good practice. If you have a minute left, would you consider this pseudo code:

```python
class FooStub:
    # Serves as means to check calls to use_generated_foo() with mypy

    def bar() -> int:
        ...

class GeneratedFoo(RuntimeAttrGen, FooStub):
    # Attributes made available at runtime, according to external spec.
    # I control the spec and therefore know what methods and attributes will be available,    
    # but can't hardcode implementations here.
    pass


def use_generated_foo(x: FooStub)
    x.bar()
```

Would you recommend another approach for type checking such runtime-determined types? E.g., I'd rather avoid deriving from `FooStub` in favor of structural subtyping. But then I don't know how to associate `GeneratedFoo` with attributes and methods as in `FooStub`.

IIUC the situation, my personal preference would be to replace `...` with `raise AttributeNotGeneratedError`. This way if empty stub is used accidentally, you will know immediately, instead of discovering random `None` somewhere down the call stack.
To clarify, mypy will also not complain about this.

issue.title: Mypy 0.990 Release Planning
issue.body:
I am planning to make a 0.990 release around late October.

Please post here any issues you'd like to see fixed in the release, or PRs you'd like to have merged. There is no release branch yet - I will update the issue once it exists.

issue.title: Update --no-warn-no-return docs for empty body changes
Fix failing Python test
issue.body:
I looked at approving some PRs this evening, and see that one of the tests of python scripts has started failing:
https://github.com/obsidian-community/obsidian-hub/actions/runs/3448377582

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4840096/201441078-3370a7f7-23ce-42ef-887c-f1f63baecf47.png)

I've had a quick look at the code and nothing has changed recently, so I assume it's a change in version of a tool that is being used... and pulled in via the GitHub Actions infrastructure.

The code is the second of these 2 lines:

https://github.com/obsidian-community/obsidian-hub/blob/2ab98067db49131355619e5a24e6bda3021682c9/.github/scripts/update_issues.py#L21:L22

```python
class GithubClient:
    def get(self, url: str, _get: str) -> List[Any]: ...
```
